link.synopsis: A small Cuban town spins into a frenzy when word spreads that descendants of the Castiñeiras clan will inherit a fortune that's been collecting interest in a British bank since the 18th century. But the Castiñeiras family tree is hardly clear-cut. With two bloodlines vying for the money, which side will get it is anyone's guess in director Juan Carlos Tabío's superbly crafted comedy starring Jorge Perugorría.
link.title: synopsis
R2: Y el Caso del Cadaver Sin Cabeza
El Penalti Mas Largo Del Mundo
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: An idyllic wedding in the Icelandic countryside begets chaos when a flamboyant cousin, an errant best man and uninvited guests threaten to derail the happy couple's dreams in director Valdís Óskarsdóttir's incisive comedy. Making matters worse is a fiery cleric who's more interested in bending his elbow and watching football than he is in presiding over the nuptials. The cast includes Björn Hlynur Haraldsson and Ingvar Eggert Sigurðsson.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Jay Baruchel (Tropic Thunder) stars in this wickedly dark comedy as Oliver Zinck, a nebbish loner who discovers shortly after his father's death that he's inherited a struggling funeral home that's teetering on the edge of bankruptcy. When a fortuitous accident inspires Oliver with a way to stem the business's money woes, he collaborates with a beautiful mortician (Rose Byrne) on a covert killing spree designed to drum up business.
link.title: synopsis
How to Be a Serial Killer
Never Give a Sucker an Even Break
InuYasha: The Movie: Affections Touching Across Time

link.synopsis: After suffering a fatal accident, Miguel discovers that he's not able to enter heaven as long as he harbors memories of the lovely Helena -- a woman whose heart he won only after long years of courtship. Refusing to forget Helena, Miguel leaves the afterlife in search of a way to honor their love forever. Writer-director Salim Nayar also stars in this comedy featuring Fernando Luján, Patricia Pereyra and Alec Von Bargen.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Death Beats a Dull Life
Vidas Privadas / Pantaleon Y Las Visitadores
Entre La Tarde y La Noche
No Dejare Que No Me Quieras

link.synopsis: Global warming has left all of the planet's land sunken underneath the ocean, except Japan. This politically incorrect satire explores a world where Japanese culture dominates, foreign women serve as maids and homeless refugees are Godzilla extras. Full of outrageous tongue-in-cheek humor, this science fiction comedy features Kenji Kohashi, Shuuji Kashiwabara, Masatoshi Matsuo and Takenori Murano.
link.title: synopsis
Monster X Strikes Back: Attack at the G8 Summit
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai
20th Century Boys: Chapter 2: The Last Hope
Rudy Maxa's World: Exotic Places: Japan
Death Note: L: Change the WorLd
Bounty Hunter Vixens: Treasure of Lust
When the Last Sword Is Drawn

link.synopsis: Kent's (Trent Haaga) Den O'Iniquity nightclub offers a place for locals to live out their sexual fetish fantasies, but the city council wants to shut it down. When someone begins murdering club employees, Kent finds himself in more trouble than he can handle. Part love story, musical and comedy, this Richard Griffin-directed horror film features Ken Foree, Lynn Lowry, Debbie Rochon and Sarah Nicklin.
link.title: synopsis
It's My Party and I'll Die if I Want To
Power of Evil: Die Hard Dracula / Girls' Night Out
Hell Hole / Jungle Virgin Force / Ghost Ninja / Primitives
The Christmas Season Massacre / Satan Claus / Psycho Santa

link.synopsis: Besieged matriarch Sonia (Félicité Wouassi) tries to make certain her daughter's nuptials come off flawlessly even as events spiral out of control is in this dark comedy helmed by François Dupeyron. With Sonia's wayward eldest son (Ralph Amoussou) under arrest on drug charges, she then discovers that her no-account hubby has gambled away the money set aside for the reception. Will Sonia and her family triumph or crumble in the face of adversity?
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Ten-year-old hell-raiser Léon (Antoine L'Écuyer) drives his suburban Montreal family nuts with antics that include theft, arson, general destructive behavior and multiple suicide attempts. But when his eccentric mom leaves the family, the trouble really begins. Set in a meticulously reconstructed 1968 Quebec and featuring an inventive score by Patrick Watson, this dark comedy is based on two novels by Bruno Hébert.
link.title: synopsis
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Family is everything in the mob, and Mungilal (Anupam Kher) is on the verge of losing his power because he doesn't have an heir. Hiring detective Johnny English (Satish Kaushik), Mungi sets out to find his estranged sister, Angoori (Bhavana Balsawar), whose son could be the answer to his problem. To his surprise, the search produces four young men, each of whom claims to be Angoori's son. Satish Shah also stars in this wacky mob comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Unaware that their friends are planning a lavish party for them that night, Walter Bingley (Wilfred Pickles) and his wife, Ada (Irene Handl), begin the day of their first wedding anniversary with an argument. As if that weren't bad enough, Walter loses the money for Ada's gift. Their wedded bliss continues to unravel even as they draw closer to the surprise party. Ronnie Baxter directs this comedy based on the hit British television show.
link.title: synopsis
Murder at the Vanities / Search for Beauty
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
The Knack...and How to Get It

link.synopsis: The actors of the Kalakar Theatre Company are largely oblivious to the covert warfare that's rocking their small town. But when they learn that a mob boss is plotting a major bombing, they hatch their own plan to stop him. Mistaken-identity intrigue and wild physical comedy ensue as the troupe assumes a host of disguises and puts their acting chops to the test. Mallika Sherawat, Rahul Bose and Paresh Rawal star in Sanjay Chel's slapstick farce.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Joe Joe (Gavin Lewis) is living large as the proprietor of his new rim shop -- that is, until an old loan shark comes to collect. With 24 hours to repay the debt, Joe and his pals scheme to steal a million-dollar coin in hopes of selling it to the highest bidder. Clifton Powell, Tommy "Tiny" Lister, Maia Campbell, Mr. Magic, Chavon "M.O.N.E." Higgins and George Boyd co-star in this fast-paced urban comedy.
link.title: synopsis
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
There's a Stranger in My House
Soul Theater Series: The Fabric of a Man
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
I Think I Love My Wife
I Wish I Had a House Like This
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1

link.synopsis: When the boys learn that the West is teeming with gold, they pack up and head for Alaska to get a piece of the treasure. Unfortunately, the hapless sextet fail to realize that they're 40 years too late. Bud Flanagan, Chesney Allen, Jimmy Nervo, Teddy Knox, Charlie Naughton and Jimmy Gold -- collectively known as the popular British comedy troupe the Crazy Gang -- star in this 1939 slapstick cult hit.
link.title: synopsis
Tchaikovsky: Eugene Onegin: The Metropolitan Opera
How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
Tarzan, the Ape Man / Tarzan Escapes Double Feature
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
Never Give a Sucker an Even Break

link.synopsis: Jerry Lewis voices his legendary role of Julius Kelp -- aka The Nutty Professor -- in this animated sequel to the classic comedy. Kelp's grandson, Harold (voiced by Drake Bell), finds Julius's special elixir and releases an arrogant alter ego. Soon, his dual life becomes humorously chaotic, ultimately leading to a showdown when Harold's cooler half tries to take over for good. Andrew Francis also lends his voice to the film.
link.title: synopsis
Enchanted Tales: A Tale of Egypt / Tarzan of the Apes
The Prince and the Pauper: Double Trouble
Robin Hood: Quest for the King
Alice in Wonderland: What's the Matter with Hatter?
The Three Musketeers: Saving the Crown
The Jungle Book: Rikki-Tikki-Tavi to the Rescue
Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves: The Lost Scimitar of Arabia
Wallace & Gromit: A Matter of Loaf and Death
The Hidden Treasure of Wompkee Wood
Pirates Who Don't Do Anything: A VeggieTales Movie
The True Story of Puss 'n Boots
My Friends Tigger & Pooh: Super Duper Super Sleuths
Arthur and the Invisibles: The New Minimoy Adventures
Little Polar Bear: Lars and the Little Tiger
VeggieTales: LarryBoy and the Bad Apple
Adventures in Odyssey: In Harm's Way
The Wheels on the Bus: Mango and Papaya's Animal Adventure
Fantastic History of the Ugly Duckling
Return to Mushsnail: The Legend of the Snowmill
Disney Princess Stories: Vol. 1: A Gift From the Heart
Disney Princess Sing-Along Songs: Once Upon a Dream
Hermie & Friends: Webster the Scaredy Spider
Tom and Jerry: Blast Off to Mars

title.regular: The Nutty Professor 2: Facing the Fear
title.short: The Nutty Professor 2: Facing the Fear

link.synopsis: In this children's comedy from China National Classic Stage Arts, young An Xiaohua travels from her remote mountain village to Suzhou City, accompanied by her teacher, who gets sick when a boy plays a prank on her. Now, An must find work in order to pay for medical treatment. A chance encounter with the same boy leads An to discover that the city's culture and attitudes are nothing like her small-town ways.
link.title: synopsis
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
A Post in White Birch Forest
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power
Detective Dee and the Mystery of the Phantom Flame
On the Mountain of Tai Hang

link.synopsis: This unique, award-winning comedy follows Mattie Fresno (Angela Pierce), whose physicist grandfather (Orson Bean) dies while trying to unlock the secrets of the universe. Even in death, he seems to affect Mattie and her work in the family's public relations firm. Plagued by hallucinations and accused of murdering a client, Mattie turns to her grandfather's seemingly incomprehensible theories for help. Carol Alt and Ellen Cleghorne co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

title.regular: Mattie Fresno and the Holoflux Universe
title.short: Mattie Fresno and the Holoflux Universe

link.synopsis: Fifteen-year-old Román (Juan Pablo de Santiago) has been expelled from yet another school, but not before meeting Maru (Maria Deschamps), a kindred spirit. Frustrated by their outsider status, the two pretend to run away, camping out on the roof of Román's family mansion. But their new life of ease comes under fire when Maru's family moves in with Román's parents to await the pair's return. Rebecca Jones co-stars in this coming-of-age comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Good, the Bad, the Weird
A Constant Forge: The Life and Art of John Cassavetes

link.synopsis: When ordinary middle-school student Kenny Witokwski (Bill Switzer) connects with an Internet chat-room buddy known as "Average Joe," he doesn't suspect his new friend is none other than A. Thorton Osgood II (Randy Quaid), the president of the United States. Could Kenny's candid advice to Average Joe help change the course of the entire country? Eric Champnella directs this family-friendly comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Treasure Island Kids: The Pirates of Treasure Island
Charlie's Ghost: The Secret of Coronado
The Strongest Man in the World
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia

link.synopsis: When computer whiz Dr. Vivien Morgan (Whoopi Goldberg) shoots through time back to King Arthur's court in medieval England, she must use all her scientific cunning to find a way back home. Along the way, she teaches the archaic king (Michael York) a thing or two about the power of women to hold their own against any man. Roger Young directs this comedy that also stars Ian Richardson, Amanda Donohoe, Simon Fenton and Paloma Baeza.
link.title: synopsis
A Kid in King Arthur's Court
Labou and the Quest for the Lost Treasure
Josh Kirby, Time Warrior: Human Pets
Josh Kirby, Time Warrior: Trapped on Toy World
The Pirates of Tortuga: Under the Black Flag
Josh Kirby, Time Warrior: Planet of the Dino Knights
T-Rex: Back to the Cretaceous: IMAX
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland

link.synopsis: When high school science geek Ben Cooper (Ryan Merriman) and his family win a state-of-the-art computerized "smart house," the home's personal applied technology -- "PAT" -- becomes an overbearing mother figure that threatens to ruin their lives. Now, Ben must draw upon all his technological know-how to beat PAT at her own game. LeVar Burton directs this comedy that also stars Katey Sagal and Kevin Kilner.
link.title: synopsis
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs

link.synopsis: When Parisian businesswoman Odile (Sabine Azéma) needs a new apartment, her sister Camille (Agnès Jaoui) offers the services of her lover, real estate broker Marc (Lambert Wilson). Soon the trio, along with several admirers and former lovers, gets swept up in various romantic entanglements. Alain Resnais directs this romantic comedy that features the characters singing along to a host of French pop songs (a la Moulin Rouge).
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: When errant Pedro (José Alonso) unexpectedly returns to his family in Mexico City, he whisks his wife into the bedroom, leaving their three children to while away the night contemplating the best payback for his long absence. One child wants to run away, one pretends he is a bird, and a third plots to kill their father. Meanwhile, the neighbors suffer from strange proclivities of their own. Benjamín Cann directs this erotic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When a drunken leprechaun inside a beer bottle grants high school geek Bill (Steven Cooke) three wishes, Bill thinks his girl troubles are over and asks the little guy to land him a date with beautiful cheerleader Krissi (Lezlie Z. McCraw). But when the alcoholic leprechaun can't keep his magic straight, Bill faces a whole new set of unexpected problems. Michael Paul Girard directs this teen comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Poultrygeist: Night of the Chicken Dead
The Cheerleaders Collection: Revenge of the Cheerleaders
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
The Day My Parents Ran Away
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: Actor and quipster Rodney Perry serves as your host for this outrageous second installment of the "Cut'n It Up" standup comedy series, which features hot up-and-coming talents such as Joey Wells and Rayzor telling it the way they see it in Big D. Also on tap: Mark Fernandez, Q and Juan Villereal, who uncork hilarious -- and uncensored -- routines. No topic is off limits for these wickedly funny wisecrackers.
link.title: synopsis
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Paul Rodriguez's Latin All-Stars of Comedy: Vol. 1
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Rerun's In The Hood / Rerun's Comedy Jam
Lil JJ's Almost Grown: Variety Show
Beauty Shop: The Original Stage Play
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 2
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: When a trumpet player trying to get through a wretched hangover plays his horn to soothe himself, the melody rouses the angels in heaven who are responsible for commencing Judgment Day. All the commotion resurrects the buried corpse of an elderly woman -- who comes back to life in the form of a blushing young beauty. Daniela Alvarado and Aura Rivas star in this Venezuelan comedy from director Olegario Barrera.
link.title: synopsis
Vidas Privadas / Pantaleon Y Las Visitadores
10 Things I Hate About You: Vol. 1
Don't Die Without Telling Me Where You're Going
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power
Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives
Don't Let Me Die on a Sunday
Donde Quedo La Abuela? El Viaje De La Nonna

link.synopsis: With the help of his best friend, Alicia (Jane Benney), computer tech and aspiring filmmaker Jared (Milan Tresnak) tries to meet his dream girl, Hollywood actress Melissa (Kimberly Estrada). But as Jared puts his plan into motion, he starts realizing that love may be closer than he thought. Filmed on location in Hawaii, this romantic comedy also stars Andy Bumatai, Stan Egi, Maxwell Smart and Joel Yago.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
How to Go Out on a Date in Queens

link.synopsis: About to retire from a successful career, Bill (Kurtwood Smith) cuts off his adult daughter Dee Dee's (Lisa Ann Walter) limitless allowance to make her grow up. As Dee Dee attempts survive in the real world without her father's help, she starts learning how to thrive on adversity. Full of silly surprises and infectious laughs, this lovable comedy co-stars Mason Gamble, J.P. Manoux and John M. Watson Sr.
link.title: synopsis
The Naughty Show: All Girl Comedy
The Ballad of Jack and Rose

link.synopsis: Hard-driving stockbroker Raj Puri (Sushant Singh) and his wife Abha (Kartika Rane) look forward to peace and quiet in the suburbs of Mumbai as they move into their new flat. But when the whistle of a night watchman prevents Raj from sleeping, the problems begin. Before long, the sleep-deprived Raj is a wreck at home and work, but is the whistle the real problem? Rajat Kapoor co-stars as the put-upon building secretary in this Indian comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: The debut feature from Russian cinema pioneer Aleksandr Medvedkin, this slapstick silent comedy centers on a downtrodden peasant named Khmyr who follows his dreams of prosperity into a plummeting spiral of mishap and misadventures. Filmed in 1934, Medvedkin's classic was banned in his native country for more than 40 years, criticized for satirizing the new Soviet society and for containing "anti-Bolshevik" overtones.
link.title: synopsis
The Battle of Chile: Part 1: The Insurrection of the Bourgeoisie
Three Films by Alexander Sokurov: Oriental Elegy / Dolce / A Humble Life
Helena: First Pilgrim to the Holy Land
Avant-Garde: Experimental Cinema of the 1920s and '30s: Vol. 1
Britten: The Turn of the Screw
Science Is Fiction: 23 Films by Jean Painlevé
The End of St. Petersburg / Deserter
Earth / The End of St. Petersburg / Chess Fever
Outskirts / The Girl with the Hatbox
Eugene Onegin: Classic Motion Picture with the Bolshoi Opera

link.synopsis: When his wife leaves him because he can't support their family, Fred (Stanislas Merhar) teams up with former flame Sandrine (Raphaele Godin) and enigmatic African "prince" Maguette (Emile Abossolo M'bo) on a wild robbery spree through Southern France. But despite all the excitement, Fred can't get his wife off his mind. French director Jean-Claude Brisseau's dark comedy was named one of the top 10 films of 2000 by Cahiers du Cinéma.
link.title: synopsis
Sin Syndicate / Sin Magazine / She Came on the Bus: Triple Feature
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Believing terrorists will launch a nuclear attack on Los Angeles, the obsessively paranoid Carl (Hill Harper) joins forces with his new buddy Tom Arnold (who plays himself) to protect himself and his loved ones. His neighbors and friends think Carl is crazy -- especially when he builds a bomb shelter. But worst of all, his frenzied activity threatens to destroy his marriage with Viv (Robinne Lee) in this satirical comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Man Is Hard to Find
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
The 2006 Academy Award Short Films Collection

link.synopsis: Suffering amnesia after an attack by a rival gambler, beautiful high roller Ying Ying (Natalie Meng) turns to a debt collector (Nick Cheung) to deal her back into a high-stakes gambling tournament. Now, she must face down her assailant across the gaming table, even as her new benefactor vies for her affections. Jing Wong directs this comedy that also stars Meng Yao and Cheung Tat Ming.
link.title: synopsis
Kung Fu Mahjong 3: The Final Duel
Love Is a Many Stupid Thing
The Story of an Abducted Woman
The Legend of the Flying Swordsman
I Don't Want to Sleep Alone
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman

title.regular: My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
title.short: My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro

link.synopsis: Having succumbed to his battle with cancer, Bussan (Junichi Okada) returns from the dead in ghostly form to visit Bambi (Sho Sakurai) and his other baseball-loving pals back in Kisarazu. But Bussan causes widespread havoc when he accidentally brings back to life an American baseball team that drowned off the coast of Japan. Now, the friends must put a stop to all these otherworldly shenanigans. Fumiki Kaneko directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Death Note: L: Change the WorLd
A Little Snow Fairy Sugar: Collection 2

link.synopsis: When his girlfriend, Rhona (Kazandra Santana), dumps him to join an archaeological dig in Mexico, chronic couch potato Steve (Andres Londono) rouses himself and heads south of the border after her. He soon develops an unexpected soulful connection with Mexico and its people. Learning he may have a rival for Rhona's affections, Steve hopes his transformation is enough to win her back. Scott Marcano directed and co-wrote this indie romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Other End of the Line
The Prince & Me 3: A Royal Honeymoon

link.synopsis: After tenacious Duane Balfour (Douglas Smith) loses a high-school election to rich and popular Chad Milton (Nicholas Carella), Duane one-ups his nemesis by running for town mayor against the longtime incumbent: Chad's grandmother (Rosemary Dunsmore). With help from pretty girlfriend Molly (Jane McGregor) and an oddball uncle (Donal Logue), Duane gets a crash course in politics and growing up in this quirky comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Lord, Save Us from Your Followers
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen

link.synopsis: Eva (Blanca Guerra) tries to rebuild her life after her husband, Joaquin (Jose Alonso), abandons her for a sexy younger woman (Rocio Verdejo). When an accident leaves Joaquin needing constant care, Eva takes him into her home and debates whether to punish or forgive him for his past cruelty. Leon Serment writes and directs this Mexican comedy that also stars Alfredo Sevilla, Enoc Leano and Cassandra Ciangherotti.
link.title: synopsis
Donde Quedo La Abuela? El Viaje De La Nonna

link.synopsis: After growing up in the United States with foster parents, Abby (Ruffa Gutierrez) returns to the Philippines to meet her biological mother, Esme (Annabelle Rama). Arrogant and forthright, Abby continually butts heads with her annoying mother, who tries to control her kids' lives. A family comedy about polar opposite personalities, this Filipino movie co-stars J.C. de Vera, Mart Escudero and Michelle Madrigal.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: In a hilarious send-up of Verdi's final opera, itself an adaptation of Shakespeare's "The Merry Wives of Windsor," director Tony Britten's irreverent comedy centers on the blundering high jinks of a portly would-be golfer named Big John Falstaff (Ian Jervis). Angling for a way to avoid paying his enormous bar tab, Falstaff looks to seduce one of the many female suburbanites who frequent the golf course.
link.title: synopsis
Natalie Dessay: Greatest Moments on Stage
Georges Bizet: Les Pecheurs De Perles
Anna Netrebko: Mozart: Le Nozze di Figaro
Cook, Dixon & Young: In Concert: Vol. 1
La Traviata: Love & Sacrifice: The Story of the Opera
Opera Australia: Celebration: 40 Years Of Australian Opera
Henze: L'Upupa Und Der Triumph Der Sohnesliebe
Reopening Gala of the Teatro La Fenice
Renee Fleming and Bryn Terfel: Under the Stars
Bravo Domingo: The Best of Placido Domingo
Maria Callas: Living and Dying for Art and Love
The Hidden Heart: A Life of Benjamin Britten and Peter Pears
The Art of Singing: Golden Voices of the Century
Russell Watson: Live in New Zealand

link.synopsis: When limo driver John Bourgignon (John Candy) gets engaged to Nancy Reese (Alley Mills) -- much to the chagrin of her congressman father (Pat Hingle) -- John becomes the target of the politician's enemies: a religious cult of aerobics instructors. Fellow Second City alumni Eugene Levy and Joe Flaherty join Candy in this wacky 1983 comedy that spoofs kung-fu movies, "Leave It to Beaver" and The Manchurian Candidate.
link.title: synopsis
SCTV: Best of the Early Years
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 3
To Be or Not To Be
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life

link.synopsis: Anxiety-ridden Samantha (Sarah Thompson) finally gains some confidence when she starts blogging, and even lands an ad agency copywriter job in this romantic comedy. But things get complicated when her revealing blog becomes a hit with her officemates. Now, her co-workers are trying to get her attention in the most unusual ways so they can make it into her blog. Meanwhile, a budding romance with a client (David O'Donnell) hangs in the balance.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Forced to find a new career after losing his beloved restaurant, 38-year-old chef Clay Maguire (D.B. Sweeney) starts applying for entry-level corporate positions -- and soon realizes he's considered unemployable. As he meets others in the same boat, including aging engineer Bob (Steve Ryan) and former Peace Corps worker Liz (Missi Pyle), they support each other through various failed interviews. Taylor Negron co-stars in this entertaining comedy.
link.title: synopsis
In the Kingdom of the Blind
Southlander: Diary of a Desperate Musician
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Out-of-work actor Fred (Rhett Giles) takes a temporary job as a secretary for a law firm and immediately falls for Leslie (Joy Smithers), a high-strung attorney. She feels something for Fred in return, but fears that her fellow lawyers will deride her dating a temp. Now, it's up to Fred to convince Leslie that when it comes to love, hers is the only opinion that should matter. Walter Kennard co-stars in this award-winning romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Other End of the Line
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Out of work and ready to drink his life away, aging ex-clown Seymour Smiles (Sid Haig) returns home to the town of Peru, Ind. With urging from his friend, Bob (Richard Riehle), Seymour starts training local amateur clowns, which helps him get his life back on track. Surreal settings and colorful characters populate this comedy, which shows just how important passion and laughter are for a happy life.
link.title: synopsis
Rick Steves: Eastern Europe, Israel and Egypt 2000-2009
Edgar Allan Poe: Tales of Mystery & Imagination
WWE: Allied Powers: The World's Greatest Tag Teams
All the Way: The Kidnapping of a Music Legend
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: Craving laughs? Karen Williams brings her irreverent humor to a sold-out audience at the Knitting Factory in Hollywood, Calif. A pioneer in lesbian stand-up comedy, Williams talks about dating younger woman, the bygone days of tireless sex and more. The laughs continue with stories from a lesbian sex workshop, troublesome airline travel, the conundrums of Internet dating and other exploits. It's a sidesplitting hour of delicious humor.
link.title: synopsis
Vickie Shaw: You Can Take the Girl Outta Texas...
Suzanne Westenhoefer: A Bottom on Top
Suzanne Westenhoefer: Live at the Village
Platinum Comedy Series: The Good, The Badd, The Funny
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
I'm the One That I Want
Another Gay Sequel: Gays Gone Wild!

title.regular: Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
title.short: Karen Williams: I Need a Snack

link.synopsis: A wrong-number phone call inspires Manhattan recluse Walter (Roger Hendricks Simon) to stir up some excitement in his life by placing an ad to sublet his tiny apartment. Before long, he's showing his place to a parade of potential friends and tenants, but when a runaway rock star wannabe (Tiffany Lee) and a hit man (Ross Pivec) come knocking, Walter suddenly has all the drama he can handle -- and more. Georgiana Nestor directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: When Icelandic poet and dope dealer Anna (Didda Jónsdóttir) decides to move to a sunnier clime, she plans to raise cash by selling her lengthy client list to another dealer. But her plan goes awry when she enjoys a bit too much of her own product. Soon, her scheme turns into a trippy journey involving a suicidal old friend, a French graduate student, a goose and plenty of smoke along the way. Sólveig Anspach directs this offbeat comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Girl Who Played with Fire
Pusher 3: I'm the Angel of Death
Pusher 2: With Blood on My Hands
The Amazing Truth About Queen Raquela
Botswana: In the Footsteps of the No. 1 Ladies' Detective

link.synopsis: Determined to make his mark, sports enthusiast Jonathan Sawyer (Jonathan Gotsick) creates an unconventional new sport inspired by America's love of shopping. Recruiting a diverse group of contestants, Sawyer organizes the first-ever National Aisling Championship. Gotsick is the only actor in Tamas Bojtor and Sybil Dessau's hybrid comedy: The rest of the cast are real people and the offbeat aisling championship is authentic and unscripted.
link.title: synopsis
The Pink Floyd and Syd Barrett Story
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Major League 3: Back to the Minors
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place

link.synopsis: Love and lust play out against the backdrop of scenic Palm Springs, Calif., in this romantic comedy charting the amorous adventures of a group of sun-kissed college kids (including Connie Stevens, Robert Conrad and Jerry Van Dyke). Andrew Duggan portrays the frazzled police chief whose pretty daughter (Stefanie Powers) catches the eye of a vacationing heartthrob (Troy Donahue) in town for spring break.
link.title: synopsis
Gidget Goes Hawaiian / Gidget Goes to Rome
Tammy Tell Me True / Tammy and the Doctor
Live a Little, Love a Little
The Knack...and How to Get It
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation

link.synopsis: Plagued by poor sales at his ice cream shop, depraved Ricky (Richard Van Vleet) hires some sexy "Scoopettes" (Bobbi Billard, Akira Lane and Gelusa Zaripova) and starts selling new "adult" flavors including Orgasmic Orange, Virgin Vanilla and Peppermint Panties. But when the girls start turning up dead, there may be a few extra goodies in the frozen desserts -- including eyeballs and other body parts -- in this campy horror comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Horror Movie Ever Made: The Re-Make
Hell House: The Book of Samiel
Zombies / The Blood Seekers / Blood Stalkers
The Curse of the Black Dahlia

link.synopsis: Promoted to a new position in a "big city" London post office, unassuming mail carrier Harold Petts (Spike Milligan) makes a splash on his first day when his arrival inadvertently foils a mail train robbery in this classic comedy. When he immediately gains recognition for his mail-sorting prowess, Harold catches the eye of the police, who assume that the amiable postman is plotting to rob his new place of employment.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Swiss Family Robinson: The Complete Series
Are You Being Served?: The Movie
Village of the Damned / Children of the Damned
Live a Little, Love a Little
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People

link.synopsis: Director Yukihiko Tsutsumi wrings laughs out of an unlikely topic -- domestic violence -- in this dark comedy about noodle-shop waitress Yukie Morita (Miki Nakatani), who puts up with the fiery temper, gambling and cruelty of her shiftless, ex-gangster boyfriend (Hiroshi Abe). But as flashbacks reveal, there's a reason behind Yukie's unconditional love for her man. Yûko Natori and Mayumi Sada also star.
link.title: synopsis
20th Century Boys: Chapter 2: The Last Hope
Bounty Hunter Vixens: Treasure of Lust
When the Last Sword Is Drawn
Warm Water Under a Red Bridge

link.synopsis: Distressed that her wayward husband, Gianni (Alberto Lionello), forsakes her favors and seduces a series of other women, drop-dead gorgeous Gioia (Edwige Fenech) turns to handsome lothario Patrizio (Ray Lovelock) to help her get revenge. Will her enthusiastic affair help Gianni see the error of his ways? Luciano Martino directs this saucy comedy that also stars Aldo Maccione, Alvaro Vitali and Olga Bisera.
link.title: synopsis
5 Dolls for an August Moon / Four Times That Night
The Loves and Times of Scaramouche
Open Letter to the Evening News
Emanuelle and the White Slave Trade

title.regular: The Virgo, The Taurus and The Capricorn
title.short: The Virgo, The Taurus and The Capricorn

link.synopsis: When he discovers that his boarder -- a promising young novelist (David Boreanaz) who owes months of back rent -- has been taking advantage of his hospitality, frustrated musician John Vandermark (Alan Cumming) ties up and beats him. But when the treatment goes further than he expects, Vandermark hatches a new scheme to achieve the critical fame that always eluded him. Anne Heche and Carrie Fisher co-star in this black comedy. Cumming directs.
link.title: synopsis
Show Business: The Road to Broadway
Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai

link.synopsis: When New Yorker Alex (Andrea Marcellus) goes to South Carolina for her sister Jeannie's (Desi Lydic) wedding, she doesn't want her bigoted family to know about her black, Jewish fiancé -- so instead, they arrive at the conclusion that Alex is gay. Alex decides that the misunderstanding is better than the truth, but when Jeannie visits her in New York, Alex has trouble maintaining the lie in this entertaining comedy of errors.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: After three female nightclub performers steal a hazardous package from a pair of robbers, the trio gets entangled in a web of deception as they attempt to keep the thieves at bay while pursuing their big dreams of stardom. Through it all, the ladies endure the crazy plot with style and panache in this sexy showbiz comedy that stars Monserrat de Leon, Guillermo Larrea, Aleyda Gallardo and Connie Valmont.
link.title: synopsis
Jennifer Lopez Presents: Como Ama Una Mujer
She Likes Girls 4: Tomboys & Tough Girls

link.synopsis: The gorgeous but completely superficial Lorenza decides to marry the fat and ugly Romeo purely for his money. But when Romeo gets fed up with his wife's abusive behavior, he does not get mad -- he gets even. He leaves the house, and with the help of his trusty pal, Justi, gets an extreme makeover into a handsome hunk. This heartwarming romantic comedy stars Paco Ibáñez, Ricardo Martínez Benítez and Lourdes Munguía.
link.title: synopsis
Vidas Privadas / Pantaleon Y Las Visitadores

link.synopsis: Certain he'll get hit by a milk truck and die on his 25th birthday -- just like his father and grandfather did -- Charlie Silvercloud III (Robert A. Guthrie) falls for terminal cancer patient Bessie (Sascha Knopf) and tries to spend his last few days with her. Rick Stevenson writes and directs this dark romantic comedy, which is set in Seattle and also stars David Keith, Richard Sanders and Ned Romero.
link.title: synopsis
How to Go Out on a Date in Queens
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: After trading an "invisible" watch for another boy's magnet, Johnny (James Fox) runs away from home convinced he's wanted by the police. With his imagination running wild, Johnny goes through a series of misadventures as he tries to get rid of the magnet. Propelled by half-truths and serious misunderstandings, this English comedy also stars Stephen Murray, Kay Walsh, Meredith Edwards and Gladys Henson.
link.title: synopsis
Cinema's Dark Side: Impact/ Second Woman/ They Made Me a Criminal
King and Country / Angels One Five
Brigitte and Brigitte / Up and Down: The Films of Luc Moullet
Bela Lugosi Meets a Brooklyn Gorilla
There's No Business Like Show Business

link.synopsis: When scientists realize that Pasquale's (Totò) blood is similar to that of a monkey's, they decide to send him on a mission into space. But Pasquale's exploration of the cosmos experiences setbacks when German spies and aliens harass him and his partner. A legendary Italian comedian, Totò provides many laughs in this science fiction comedy, which also stars Sylva Koscina, Ugo Tognazzi and Sandra Milo.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: San Francisco con woman Molly (Betty Compson) meets her match in the form of a dapper jewel thief, the Dude from Duluth (Raymond Griffiths). After trying to outsmart one another, the competitive criminals team up to steal a valuable diamond pendant. A romantic comedy set in the exciting world of cat burglars and cops, this classic silent movie also stars Tom Santschi, Edgar Kennedy and Bert Woodruff.
link.title: synopsis
Doctor of Doom / The Wrestling Women vs. The Aztec Mummy: Double Feature
The Outlaw and His Wife / Victor Sjostrom
The Oyster Princess / I Don't Want to Be a Man
The Three Stooges: Soup to Nuts
The Lon Chaney Collection: The Unknown
The King of the Wild Horses
The Lon Chaney Collection: The Ace of Hearts

link.synopsis: When his wealthy fiancée, Ashley (Karen Travis), dumps him at the altar and runs off with a Mormon man to Salt Lake City, poor Jersey guy Jed (James Tupper) teams up with ambitious, voluptuous sex hotline talker Mimi (Lorri Bagley) and crooner Johnny Pompano Jr. to break up the union. Will Jed win back Ashley's love? Monty Diamond produces and directs this screwball romantic comedy, while Billy Campion and Aasif Mandvi co-star.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In a harmless ploy to be closer to the man of her dreams -- magazine tycoon Miggy Montenegro (John Lloyd Cruz) -- Laida (Sarah Geronimo) lands a job as his assistant, but quickly discovers that he's a far cry from the Prince Charming she envisioned. Directed by Cathy Garcia Molina, this lighthearted romantic comedy also stars Dante Rivero, Rowell Santiago, Johnny Revilla, Bing Pimental and Daphne Oseña-Paez.
link.title: synopsis
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: The Philippines's "King of Comedy" Rodolfo Vera Quizon -- better known simply as Dolphy -- is the subject of this incisive documentary that traces the life and career of the award-winning entertainer. Featuring a compilation of excerpts of Dolphy's work as well as a series of interviews with those who know him best, this chronicle offers a fascinating glimpse into both the public and private lives of a comedic legend.
link.title: synopsis
Tony Palmer's Film About the Salzburg Festival
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: The life of gruff tricycle deliverer Olga (Maricel Soriano) gets thrown for a loop when she collides with fellow rider Truman (William Martinez), and the love-struck vendor makes it his mission to win her heart. Acclaimed Filipino director Ishmael Bernal (Himala) helms this charming romantic comedy that also stars Bayani Casimiro, Manny Castañeda, Perry Fajardo and Opalyn Forster.
link.title: synopsis
Manila by Night: City After Dark
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: This charming comedy follows six strangers -- an aspiring entertainer (Jolina Magdangal), a housekeeper (Eugene Domingo), a lounge singer (Rufa Mae Quinto), a waiter (Mark Herras), a businessman (Dennis Trillo) and a spoiled young girl (Rhian Ramos) -- whose lives become intertwined when they sign up for a seven-day European cruise. Despite their differences, they're all searching for the same thing: love. Mark A. Reyes directs.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: In Don Cuaresma's charming ensemble comedy, a call center sets the stage for a slew of burgeoning romances, including a liaison between lovers-in-denial Tom Base (Polo Ravales) and his beautiful best friend, Lane Cruz (Yasmien Kurdi). Meanwhile, Jepoi (J.C. de Vera) and Cyrill (Jean Garcia) struggle to keep their May-December affair under wraps, and would-be model Bry (Ehra Madrigal) finds herself inexplicably drawn to cab driver Axel (John Prats).
link.title: synopsis
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
Enteng Kabisote 3: Okay Ka Fairy Ko

link.synopsis: Celebrated Filipina actress Maricel Soriano does triple duty in this 1988 comedy as a trio of widely different triplets: Maria, the naive dimwit; Mary, the flamboyant starlet; and Marie, the masculine streetwise gal. Separated at birth, the trio is completely unaware of each other's existence until destiny intervenes and a series of unforeseen events force their disparate worlds to collide in hilarious fashion.
link.title: synopsis
Manila by Night: City After Dark

link.synopsis: One year after their devastating breakup, gay beautician Coring (Dolphy) is bowled over when his former boyfriend, Dennis (Philip Salvador), shows up at his door and asks him to care for his newborn son. Featuring a rare dramatic performance by Dolphy -- the renowned "King of Philippine Comedy" -- Lino Brocka's moving 1978 drama is regarded as the first Filipino film to offer a sympathetic portrayal of gay men.
link.title: synopsis
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote
The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes
Manila by Night: City After Dark

link.synopsis: After claiming the crown in her hometown's "Miss Soy Sauce" beauty contest, unassuming cleaning lady Pilar (Maricel Soriano) uses her grand prize trip to the United States to search for her long-lost sister. Maryo J. De los Reyes directs this fish-out-of-water comedy that also stars Lovella De Cordova, Mitch Valdez, Joey de Leon, Katy de la Cruz, and Gabby Concepcion as good-hearted, handsome stranger Pepe.
link.title: synopsis
Manila by Night: City After Dark

link.synopsis: Living with his Dominican parents in Manhattan's Washington Heights, Juan Bago (Michael Diaz) endures unending ridicule from his friends and family. But when he spots the girl of his dreams on the subway one morning, the lovable loser needs a makeover. Making a premier at the New York International Latino Film Festival, this coming-of-age comedy from writer-director Diaz was shot on a shoestring budget.
link.title: synopsis
Paul Rodriguez's Latin All-Stars of Comedy: Vol. 1
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: When a manure company mogul dies, Rosemary Rose (Téa Leoni), the dead man's daughter, steps in to steer the company back into greener pastures -- but it won't be easy when Jimmy St. James (Kyle MacLachlan) tries to wrestle control from her. She then turns to top manure salesman Patrick (Billy Bob Thornton) to kick St. James to the back of the herd. Michael Polish directs this comedy set in the 1960s.
link.title: synopsis
I Don't Know How She Does It
South of Heaven, West of Hell
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle

link.synopsis: While attempting to deliver a misplaced bundle of World War II-era love letters to its intended recipient, a young rock 'n' roller (Van Fan) recruits a band of local musicians and finds love with an aging Japanese fashion model (Chie Tanaka). Te-Sheng Wei directs this critically acclaimed romantic comedy with a touch of drama, Taiwan's official submission for the 81st Academy Awards Best Foreign Language Film.
link.title: synopsis
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
The Map of Sex and Love

link.synopsis: Mason (Eric McCormack) and Conner (Thomas Cavanagh) are a powerhouse team for a top-rated Chicago ad agency. But as individuals, they couldn't be less alike: art director Mason is a devoted family man, while copywriter Conner is experiencing a prolonged adolescence. Their harried boss (Griffin Dunne), meanwhile, fears that his own days in the ad game are numbered. Monica Potter co-stars in this comedy from the creators of "The Closer."
link.title: synopsis
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: After the Funeral
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Taken at the Flood
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Mystery of the Blue Train
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Cards on the Table
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Cat Among the Pigeons
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Mrs. McGinty's Dead
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Murder on the Orient Express
Masterpiece Mystery!: Poirot: Appointment with Death

link.synopsis: A sex therapist (Christa Crowe) and her husband (Shaun Green) hope that hosting a wild potluck dinner party will help them work through some of their own marital issues, in this Dogme 95 indie comedy from writer-director M. David Lee III. As the wine flows and the conversations become more intense, the boisterous group takes on such charged subjects as sex, relationships, race and booze. Glenda Pannell and Bevan Bell co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: Stuck in a humdrum life with a job he hates and a stepmother from hell, Albert Ross (Dexter Fletcher) is thrown for a loop when a mysterious accident endows him with the ability to see the future in his dreams. Written and directed by Gary Sinyor, this indie comedy also stars Linda Hamilton as Georgie, a wannabe detective, and Elize du Toit as the enigmatic bombshell Olivia.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

link.synopsis: Geeky inventor Tim (Gregg Martin) and his musician friend, Steve (Cullen Cowan), are complete opposites when it comes to winning over women. But when Tim discovers a mysterious statue that turns him into a chick magnet, it looks like his luck has changed. Things take a turn for the worse, however, when Steve's girlfriend, Renee (Joy Boden), falls for Tim. Now Tim will have to figure out how to resolve the issue in this zany comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Sex Adventures of the Three Musketeers

link.synopsis: After entertaining households with the Church Lady and his impersonations of world leaders on "Saturday Night Live," Dana Carvey continued his comedic streak in his first HBO Comedy Special, filmed in 1995. Watch and laugh as he sings the Famous Chopping Broccoli Song and a medley of every Neil Young song. He also reprises some of his best SNL bits, including his unforgettable Ross Perot impersonation, and much more.
link.title: synopsis
Dana Carvey: Squatting Monkeys Tell No Lies
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey
Richard Jeni: A Big Steaming Pile of Me
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Sinbad: Son of a Preacher Man
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Phil Hartman
George Carlin: You are All Diseased
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Dennis Miller: The HBO Comedy Specials
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York
So I Married an Axe Murderer
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Platinum Comedy Series: The Good, The Badd, The Funny
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
Dorf Da Bingo King / Dorf and the First Games of Mt. Olympus

link.synopsis: Short for The Immoral Minority Picture Show, this irreverent comedy skit anthology from writer-director Scott Mansfield is an equal-opportunity offender, skewering all facets of society with reckless abandon. Created in the tradition of the infamous Zucker Bros' classic Kentucky Fried Movie, this hilarious film features several Hollywood notables, including Fred Willard, Michael McKean, Peter Scolari, Jimmie Walker and Linda Blair.
link.title: synopsis
Marshal of Gunsmoke / Oklahoma Raiders / Arizona Days / Trouble in Texas
One Shocking Moment / The Abnormal Female / Maidens of Fetish Street
Warts & All: The Films of Danny Plotnick
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards
Yucko the Clown: The Damn Show

link.synopsis: The treasure hunt is on for a missing loot of diamonds when jewel thief Mansukh is double-crossed by his two-timing fiancée, Parijat, and her not-so-brotherly accomplice, Usman. But Mansukh may have a double-dealing surprise of his own. Just when police -- and Parijat -- think they've got the goods, they soon realize there is a puzzling lack of evidence. So who's got the gems? Amit Mistry, Sejal Shah and Dilip Rawal star in this comedy thriller.
link.title: synopsis
Som Thi Shukra Taro, Shaniware Hun Maro
Pachhi Kehta Nahi Ke Kahyun Nahotu

link.synopsis: In this Gujarati stage comedy, timid Hasu can't understand why his divorce lawyer father refuses to help his son divorce his overbearing wife. But soon Hasu realizes that what his reluctant widowed father needs is a bride -- perhaps like Hasu's wife. And the hunt for the "perfect" mate leads to a string of hilarious and unexpected situations. Amit Divetia directs this play that stars Anurag Prapanna, Pinky Parikh and Vaishali Parmar.
link.title: synopsis
Som Thi Shukra Taro, Shaniware Hun Maro

link.synopsis: In this feel-good romantic comedy, a young couple deeply in love soon finds their lives turned upside down when the girl's meddling but well-meaning father becomes the unwelcomed third wheel in their relationship. The unusual triangle leads to nothing but trouble -- and lots of laughter. Umesh Parekh directs this Gujarati play, while Deepak Dave, Manish Mehta, Santu Rajda, Henish and Grishma Shah star.
link.title: synopsis
Lakhtar Ni Ladi Ne Vilayat No Var

link.synopsis: Vipra Raval and Padmesh Pandit star in this stage comedy about a woman who tries to bring joy and contentment to those who have been browbeaten by life. When she finds a willing helper, the laughs are nonstop as she spreads a little happiness among a motley crew of misfits. Siddharath Joshi directs this amusing Gujarati play that stars Ashish Bhatt, Hitesh Sampat, Disha Vakhani, Tushar Joshi, Jayant Bhagvat, Nisha and Tanvi.
link.title: synopsis
Lakhtar Ni Ladi Ne Vilayat No Var

link.synopsis: Though he dreams of being a movie star, Lalu bends to family pressure and pretends to be a successful lawyer instead -- until one night when Sonal, a beautiful thief, breaks into his house and turns his world upside down. Falling in love, Sonal changes her dishonest ways, while Lalu discovers a thing or two about following his own heart. Siddharth Randeria directs this charming comedy that also stars Ami Trivedi and Rajul Diwan.
link.title: synopsis
Som Thi Shukra Taro, Shaniware Hun Maro
Pachhi Kehta Nahi Ke Kahyun Nahotu

link.synopsis: Naina, a young blind woman, owns a hotel, and is unaware that her guardian aunt, Shiladevi, plans to kill her. But when the murder plot goes awry, Naina's brother dies instead -- and Naina becomes the prime suspect. Now, she has only two hours to clear her name, and she enlists the help of her friends, Subash, who is mute, and Shravan, who is deaf. Directed by Ashish Bhatt, this comedy stars Hitesh Sampat, Hitesh Panchal and Suraj Vyas.
link.title: synopsis
Som Thi Shukra Taro, Shaniware Hun Maro
Lakhtar Ni Ladi Ne Vilayat No Var
Pachhi Kehta Nahi Ke Kahyun Nahotu

link.synopsis: When successful London publisher Charlie (Jason Flemyng) starts thinking that his life is a failure, he hits the road and soon stumbles upon a curious old hotel and a bevy of oddball locals, including the enchanting Grace (Kirsty Mitchell). As Charlie falls for the beauty, he begins to understand what it means to love and truly live. This charming romantic comedy from director David Fairman co-stars Samantha Beckinsale and Frank Finlay.
link.title: synopsis
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

link.synopsis: Tempted by visions of booty and bling, brothers and hopeless hip-hop wannabes Gary and Cary foolishly sign a phony record deal. Now they want out of the contract, but the only exit is to raise $100 large. Desperate, the two recruit some pals to help them pull off a heist of historic proportions, but do they really have a prayer? Crystal Burdette directs this comedy that stars Tyrell Ellis and Jeffrey Pierce.
link.title: synopsis
I'm Doing the Right Thing with the Wrong Man
The Fresh Prince of Bel Air
A Film with Me in It

link.synopsis: Simone (Tabitha Brown) and Angela (Laila Odom) stick with each other through thick and thin, until they both fall for the handsome and upstanding Calvin (Nate Jae Turner). Now all bets are off as each woman vies to win Calvin's heart all for herself. But as their devious schemes unravel, will either of them end up with the man of their dreams? Jill Maxcy directs this charming romantic comedy that co-stars Gail Gibbons and Tony Mercedes.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man
I Think I Love My Wife
Soul Theater Series: The Fabric of a Man
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
Three Ways to Get a Husband
What Kind of Love Is This?
Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!
Amour Infinity: A Brooklyn Love Story

link.synopsis: Enter the exotic world of ad executive Anibal Soler in this dark romantic comedy chronicling the "love affair" between the ad man and a beautiful billboard model whom he hallucinates is flirting with him. Not surprisingly, Soler's work and personal life suffer as he grapples with this alternative reality. Ernesto Yáñez, Isela Vega and Delia Casanova star in Mexican director Juan Andrés Bueno's first feature film in more than a decade.
link.title: synopsis
Jennifer Lopez Presents: Como Ama Una Mujer
The Beatles Hamburg & the Hamburg Sound
The Dark Side of the Heart

link.synopsis: Now that their snowboarding school is a hit and their team is winning big, Eddy and Max enjoy success to the fullest. But with their hard-partying lifestyle, the dynamic duo might just be heading for a wipeout. If they don't want to lose everything they've worked for, our heroes must valiantly battle the temptations of slackerdom and get their team back on track in this cool comedy starring Tom Green and Dave England.
link.title: synopsis
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
The Cutting Edge: Fire and Ice
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
Heart Films: Vol. 3: A Snowboard Documentary
Freezer Burn: The Invasion of Laxdale
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard

title.regular: Revenge of the Boarding School Dropouts
title.short: Revenge of the Boarding School Dropouts

link.synopsis: On the lam from creditors back home in America, dodgy Phineas T. Barnum (Burl Ives) convinces a wealthy English duke (Dennis Price) to finance a harebrained plan to blast a man to the moon from a gigantic cannon. But rivals want to beat Barnum into space, and soon intrigue and other troubles may spell doom for his latest scheme. Don Sharp directs this star-studded comedy based on the works of Jules Verne. Lionel Jeffries co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
The Three Stooges: The Outlaws Is Coming
Jayne Mansfield Collection: The Sheriff of Fractured Jaw
The Man Who Would Be King
Terminal Force / Ring Around the World
The Hammer Horror Series: The Kiss of the Vampire / Nightmare
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
A Big Hand for the Little Lady

title.regular: Jules Verne's Rocket to the Moon
title.short: Jules Verne's Rocket to the Moon

link.synopsis: Irish immigrant conductor Terry O'Toole (Johnny Hines) must prove his mettle and stop the villains who are attempting to take over Denman Connelly's (Fred Esmelton) streetcar company. O'Toole has a definite stake in the matter, as he's fallen for Connelly's gorgeous daughter, Noretta (Doris May). Frank Griffin and Charles Hines direct this silent comedy, while Dorothy Vernon, Byron Sage, Ruth Renick and Dan Mason co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Master Mystery / Terror Island / The Man from Beyond
The Wonderful, Horrible Life of Leni Riefenstahl
Landmarks of Early Film #2: Magic Melies
The First World War: The Complete Series
Slapstick Symposium: The Charley Chase Collection 2
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection 2
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection
Why Change Your Wife? / Miss Lulu Bett
The Clinging Vine / The Age of Ballyhoo
Parisian Love / Down to the Sea in Ships: Double Feature
The King of the Wild Horses

link.synopsis: Billy Crystal hosts this PBS documentary series that examines the history of humor in American entertainment, from slapstick to satire. A slew of stars appear in the classic routines that made them famous and discuss what makes comedy work. Spanning a century of laughs, the clips feature Steve Martin, Carol Burnett, Johnny Carson, Chris Rock, Cheech Marin, Roseanne and other comedic geniuses. Amy Sedaris narrates the series.
link.title: synopsis
Comic Relief: The Greatest... And the Latest
The Laurel & Hardy Collection: Vol. 2: Alone and Together
The Harold Lloyd Comedy Collection: Vol. 2
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
Inside the Actors Studio: Robin Williams
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
Slapstick Symposium: The Harold Lloyd Collection
Sid Caesar Collection: The Buried Treasures
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Harry Shearer: Now You See It
Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!! Uncensored
If God Is Willing and Da Creek Don't Rise

title.regular: Make 'Em Laugh: The Funny Business of America

link.synopsis: A hapless filmmaker may have finally struck gold when he begins romancing a woman with a wealthy father. Now, if he can just get her dad to finance his latest project, he'll finally be able to create the schlocky movie he's been wanting to make. Frank Millen, Bert Belant, Marlene Selsman and Michael Blakney star in this zany 1970s comedy that combines satire, campy sex and period animation. James Bryan wrote and directed the film.

link.synopsis: A failed stint in the beer brewing business, a shipwreck, a trip to King Arthur's court, sleuthing with Scotland Yard and other delightfully idiotic adventures populate this collection of Three Stooges shorts from 1946 to 1948. The compilation includes Curly Howard's final short, "Half-Wits Holiday," as well as the first appearances by Curly's replacement, his brother Shemp Howard. Only knuckleheads can resist this classic comedy.

link.synopsis: When hard-drinking and embittered stand-up comedian Pipes (Mike Houlihan) vents his frustration at street-dweller Nuts (Ben Vereen), Nuts curses him to walk a mile or more in his vagrant and mentally unbalanced shoes. Soon, Pipes finds himself among the outcasts of society. Struggling to keep himself fed and his sanity intact, he ends up learning a thing or two in the process. Tim Kazurinski and Greg Hollimon co-star in this quirky comedy.

Andrew Lloyd Webber: The Royal Albert Hall Celebration
The Last Lovecraft: Relic of Cthulhu
Harry Knuckles and the Pearl Necklace

link.synopsis: When 10-year-old Joshua (Lurie Poston) decides to join the cheerleading squad at his Catholic school, he faces an uphill battle -- and opposition from his single mom, Andy (Carrie Preston), who struggles to understand her Hollywood musical- and pom-pom-loving son. With the help of sympathetic neighbor Charlie (Michael Emerson), Andy attempts to embrace her son for who he is, not who she wants him to be. James Vasquez directs this touching comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Stuck in a dead-end job, relationship-challenged high school grad Kevin (Jayson Garity) thinks he may have found the answer to life's problems -- and to his obsessive masturbating -- when the lovely and mysterious Lisa (Robyn Griggs) moves in next door. But Lisa harbors a sexy, dark secret, and before long, Kevin finds himself accused of murder. Keith Boron directs this inventive comedy; Heather Summers, Michael Hanton and Ken Sechrist co-star.

link.synopsis: After literally crashing a celebrity's engagement party, tabloid reporter Ludo (Til Schweiger) is arrested and sentenced to 300 hours of community service. But new sparks fly when Ludo goes to work for day care center manager Anna (Nora Tschirner), whom he bullied as a child. Her long-awaited revenge gets complicated when feelings start to get in the way in this charming German romantic comedy.

Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 5: What All Parents Should Know
My Song Goes Round the World

link.synopsis: Seven years after leaving his Wisconsin hometown -- and his parents (Michael Cook and Donna Davidson) -- behind for good, former child prodigy Joe Zopp (Nick Holle) returns to dispel a vicious rumor that he's dead. But unraveling the circumstances of his own demise turns out to be a grand adventure. Sarah Rykal directs this oddball indie comedy shot on location for, according to the producers, "less than the cost of a used Corolla."

You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: When a surprise downsizing leaves a group of French toy factory workers angling for revenge, slow-witted Louise (Yolande Moreau) comes up with a bright idea: pool their meager resources and hire a hit man to take out the boss. Louise's go-to guy is unavailable, so she teams up with Michel (Bouli Lanners), a trailer park security guard who's hardly killed a fly. Benoît Delépine and Gustave de Kervern direct this pitch-black comedy.
